    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE2"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Strategic Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">The directors present their strategic report for the year ended 31 December 2022. </span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Principal activity</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The principal activity of the company is  the operation of wholesale cash and carry and distribution depots selling grocery, confectionery, cigarettes. alcohol and other related products.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Review of Business</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company's turnover decreased  by 1.48% to £218.05 million from £221.32 million in 2021. Like for like sales by volume showed higher percentage decrease  because of product inflation. We have continued to improve and manage availability of products during this period and where shortage was expected we carried higher level of stock, which resulted in the favourable impact on sales.
<br/>
<br/>The company's gross profit amounted to £16.95 million compared to £16.15 million for the previous year, which is an increase of £0.64 million. The increase in gross profit arisen from favourable discounts on purchases  and  due to continuous review of pricing and promotional strategy.The company's operating profit down by 33% to £4.8 million from £7.2 million in 2021.  The decrease  was due to an increase in operating cost owing to  higher inflation.
<br/>
<br/>Cash generation in the business has been positive during the period. The cash and cash equivalents at 31 December 2022 were £19.12 million compared to £17.86 million at the previous year end, provide the business a strong financial headroom.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The non-financial performance indicators  include customer satisfaction, staff turnover, health and safety and stakeholders' relationship. The directors review the performance with constant feedback from customers and other stakeholders.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Principal risks and uncertainties</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The Board has implemented internal controls to facilitate the identification, assessment and management of risk, as a reasonable assurance against adverse implications. The principal risks determined by the Board, corresponding controls and mitigation actions are set out below and is not in particular order of priority.. This represents the company's current profile and is not intended to be an exhaustive list of risks and uncertainties that may arise.
<br/>
<br/>We operate in an environment governed by strict regulations to ensure the safety and protection of customers, employees, shareholders and other stakeholders. These regulations include health and safety, employment law, data protection and the rules of money laundering and taxation law. In all cases, the Board takes its responsibilities very seriously and recognises that failure to respond to changes in regulations or stay compliant could affect its profitability and reputations. Changes in Law and regulations are reviewed on an ongoing basis to consider applicable changes, amendments to the company's policies and procedures and training to relevant employees, to ensure compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
<br/>
<br/>The industry is extremely competitive with the market being served by numerous competitors, ranging from national multiple retailers to regional independent wholesalers. The company competes by closely monitoring the activities of competitors. We have appropriate competitive price,value and promotions that drives our business and provide quality customer experience.</p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 2</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE3"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Strategic Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Among the financial performance indicators, the key performance indicators are gross profit margin, sales per department, wages per depot, stock availability and stock levels.<br/><br/>Availability of suppliers credit is essential for the company's financial performance. Any reduction in the availability of supplier credit could adversely impact the company.The company closely manage credit terms to ensure that they are met.<br/><br/>Our suppliers are core to our business. Failure to create supply capacity needed for future growth or extended disruption could significantly affect the availability of product in our depots resulting in loss of sales. Our trading teams maintain contact with our suppliers on a regular basis. Supplier performance is monitored on an ongoing basis and multiple sources of supply are secured wherever possible.<br/><br/>The company manages credit risks through the performance of credit checks of new customers and credit control procedures. In addition to credit check, the company obtain security in the form of guarantee or deeds of undertakings which can be called upon if the counter-party is in default under the terms credit agreement.<br/><br/>The company is exposed to the risk that the IT systems upon which it relies fail. The company has appropriate controls in place to mitigate the risk of system failure, including systems back up procedures and has appropriate virus protection and network security control.<br/><br/>A risk of Cyber security is reviewed on a regular basis and the Company has engaged an independent expertise to ascertain and mitigate the risks by means of improvement in processes and investment in technology.<br/><br/>Failure to meet safety standards in relation to our workplace could result in death or injury to our customers, employees or third parties which could lead to to financial and reputational loss. Policies and procedures are in place for the controls required to manage health and safety and product safety risks across the business and comply with all applicable regulations.</p>
      <p class="Title_4_Text">
        <span>
          <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;font-weight: bold;">Brexit, Covid and inflation</span>
        </span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The UK economy is experiencing considerable disruption and uncertainty due to the combined effect of Brexit, Covid-19, above average inflation and Russia Ukraine conflict.
<br/>
<br/>Key potential impacts on the business and mitigation action taken are as follows:
<br/>
<br/>Supply chain disruption of goods - we continued to work with suppliers to ensure that we have adequate stock levels of products and where a shortage of products is expected stock level is increased appropriately. 
<br/>
<br/>Inflationary pressures - we continue to monitor our pricing and promotional  strategy and operational cost efficiencies to protect our margin.
<br/></p>

        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>

    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE4"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Strategic Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Corporate Governance</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The directors are committed to promote the success of the company, and in doing so, complying with their duties under Section 172 of the Companies Act 2006. In doing this, the directors have given careful considerations to the following factors:
<br/>
<br/>-   the likely consequences of any decision in the long-terms;
<br/>-  the interest of company's employees;
<br/>-  the need to foster the company,s relationship;
<br/>-  the impact of the company's operations on the community and the environment;
<br/>-  the desirability of the company's maintaining a reputation for high standards of business conduct: and
<br/>-  the need to act fairly as between members of the company
<br/>
<br/>The directors have also considered  the company's business activities to identify the company's key stakeholders, which includes the following:
<br/>
<br/>-  Employees
<br/>-  Shareholders
<br/>-  Suppliers, insurers and contractors
<br/>-  Customers
<br/>-  Local communities and the environment
<br/>-  Government and regulatory authorities
<br/>
<br/>The Board is committed to effective engagement with all of its stakeholders. The relevance of each stakeholder group may differ and, as such, as part of its engagement with stakeholders, the board understands the relative interests and priority of each relevant stakeholder group and have regard to these, as appropriate, in its decision making.  The board acknowledges that not every decision it makes will necessarily result in a positive outcome for all stakeholder groups, however, they consider this as part of wider consideration of all stakeholder group for effective decision making.
<br/>
<br/>Every month, the Board and management team undertakes a review where they discuss the financial and strategic performance of the company and the impact of significant decisions taken in the period. The aim is to identify factors which would lead to any positive or negative impact, financial and non-financial, on the status of the company's stakeholders including its employees, shareholders, suppliers, customers, communities, the environment, regulators and the government.
<br/>
<br/>The Board and its management team regularly share reports on issues concerning employees, shareholders, customers, suppliers, insurance, contractors, communities, the environment, regulators and the government, which takes into account in its discussion and in its decision making process under section 172. Also, the Board seeks to understand  interests and views of the stakeholders and engage with them directly as appropriate.
<br/>
<br/>The risk management framework and principal risks and uncertainties are referred to above, within the business review and principal risks and uncertainties.</p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Approved by the <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionBodyAuthorisingFinancialStatements">Board</ix:nonNumeric> on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateSigningDirectorsReport">29 November 2023</ix:nonNumeric> on its behalf by:</span>
      </p>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Directors' Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">The directors present their report and the financial statements for the year ended 31 December 2022. </span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Incorporation</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company was incorporated on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="bus:DateFormationOrIncorporation">14 September 1982</ix:nonNumeric>.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;">Events since the end of the year</span>
        <br/>There have been no significant events affecting the company since the balance sheet date.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Directors of the company</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The directors who held office during the year were as follows:</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director1" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">Mohammad Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric> (deceased <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director1" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateResignation">27 September 2023</ix:nonNumeric>)</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director2" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">Nabeel Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric> (resigned <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director2" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateResignation">8 September 2023</ix:nonNumeric>)</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director3" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">Waqas Badar</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director4" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">Amaan P Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <br/>
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;">Financial Instruments</span>
        <br/>Details of the company's financial risk management objectives and policies are included in notes to the accounts.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Donations</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Charitable contributions made by the company during the year amounted to £11,909 (2021 - £49,116).</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Employee involvement</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:DescriptionArrangementsRelatedToEmployeesSuchAsProvisionInformationConsultation" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">It is the company policy to involve employees in the business and to ensure that matters of concern to them, including company's aims and objectives and its financial performance, are communicated in an open and regular way and, when appropriate,employees' view are taken into account. 
<br/>
<br/>The promotion of equal opportunities for all employees, including disabled persons,is regarded as an important priority. Applications for employment and promotion of disabled persons are treated on the basis as those from other applicants having regard to aptitude, ability, requirements of the job.</p></ix:nonNumeric>

    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">

    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Directors' Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Environmental matters</span>
      </p>

      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Disclosure of information to the auditors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:StatementOnQualityCompletenessInformationProvidedToAuditors" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Each director has taken steps that they ought to have taken as a director in order to make themselves aware of any relevant audit information and to establish that the company's auditors are aware of that information. The directors confirm that there is no relevant information that they know of and of which they know the auditors are unaware.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Approved by the <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionBodyAuthorisingFinancialStatements">Board</ix:nonNumeric> on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateSigningDirectorsReport">29 November 2023</ix:nonNumeric> on its behalf by:</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_2_Text" style="margin-top:37px;">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">
          <br/>
          <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director4" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">Amaan P Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric>
          <br/>Director</span>
      </p>

    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE7"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Statement of Directors' Responsibilities</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:StatementThatDirectorsAcknowledgeTheirResponsibilitiesUnderCompaniesAct" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">The directors acknowledge their responsibilities for preparing the Annual Report and the financial statements in accordance with applicable law and regulations.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Company law requires the directors to prepare financial statements for each financial year. Under that law the directors have elected to prepare the financial statements in accordance with United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice (United Kingdom Accounting Standards and applicable law). Under company law the directors must not approve the financial statements unless they are satisfied that they give a true and fair view of the state of affairs of the company and of the profit or loss of the company for that period. In preparing these financial statements, the directors are required to:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">select suitable accounting policies and apply them consistently;</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">make judgements and accounting estimates that are reasonable and prudent;</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">state whether applicable United Kingdom Accounting Standards have been followed, subject to any material departures disclosed and explained in the financial statements; and</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">prepare the financial statements on the going concern basis unless it is inappropriate to presume that the company will continue in business.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
        <span class="Normal_Text">The directors are responsible for keeping adequate accounting records that are sufficient to show and explain the company's transactions and disclose with reasonable accuracy at any time the financial position of the company and enable them to ensure that the financial statements comply with the Companies Act 2006. They are also responsible for safeguarding the assets of the company and hence for taking reasonable steps for the prevention and detection of fraud and other irregularities.</span>
      </p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 7</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE8"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Opinion</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We have audited  the financial statements of United Wholesale Grocers Limited (the 'company') for the year ended 31 December 2022, which comprise the Statement of Comprehensive Income, Statement of Comprehensive Income, Balance Sheet, Statement of Changes in Equity, and Notes to the Financial Statements, including a summary of significant accounting policies. The financial reporting framework that has been applied in their preparation is applicable law and United Kingdom Accounting Standards, including Financial Reporting Standard 102 The Financial Reporting Standard applicable in the UK and Republic of Ireland (United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice).</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In our opinion the financial statements:</p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:OpinionAuditorsOnEntity" xml:space="preserve"><table style="width: 100%;"><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">give a true and fair view of the state of the company's affairs as at 31 December 2022 and of its profit for the year then ended;</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">have been properly prepared in accordance with United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice; and</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">have been prepared in accordance with the requirements of the Companies Act 2006.</p></td></tr></table></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Basis for opinion</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (UK) (ISAs (UK)) and applicable law. Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the auditor responsibilities for the audit of the financial statements section of our report. We are independent of the company in accordance with the ethical requirements that are relevant to our audit of the financial statements in the UK, including the FRC’s Ethical Standard, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.</p>
      <p/>
      <p>
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;">Conclusions relating to going concern</span>
      </p>
      <p style="text-align:left;">
        <span class="Normal_Text">In auditing the financial statements, we have concluded that the director's use of the going concern basis of accounting in the preparation of the financial statements is appropriate. </span>
      </p>
      <p style="text-align:left;">
        <span class="Normal_Text">Based on the work we have performed, we have not identified any material uncertainties relating to events or conditions that, individually or collectively, may cast significant doubt on the company's ability to continue as a going concern for a period of at least twelve months from when the original financial statements were authorised for issue.</span>
      </p>
      <p style="text-align:left;">
        <span class="Normal_Text">Our responsibilities and the responsibilities of the directors with respect to going concern are described in the relevant sections of this report.</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Other information</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The directors are responsible for the other information. The other information comprises the information included in the annual report, other than the financial statements and our auditor’s report thereon. Our opinion on the financial statements does not cover the other information and, except to the extent otherwise explicitly stated in our report, we do not express any form of assurance conclusion thereon.<br/><br/><br/> </p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 8</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE9"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:StatementAuditorsResponsibilitiesRelatingToOtherInformation" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">In connection with our audit of the financial statements, our responsibility is to read the other information and, in doing so, consider whether the other information is materially inconsistent with the financial statements or our knowledge obtained in the audit or otherwise appears to be materially misstated. If we identify such material inconsistencies or apparent material misstatements, we are required to determine whether there is a material misstatement in the financial statements or a material misstatement of the other information. If, based on the work we have performed, we conclude that there is a material misstatement of this other information, we are required to report that fact.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We have nothing to report in this regard.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Opinion on other matter prescribed by the Companies Act 2006</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In our opinion, based on the work undertaken in the course of the audit:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the information given in the Strategic Report and Directors' Report for the financial year for which the financial statements are prepared is consistent with the financial statements; and</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the Strategic Report and Directors' Report have been prepared in accordance with applicable legal requirements.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Matters on which we are required to report by exception</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In the light of our knowledge and understanding of the company and its environment obtained in the course of the audit, we have not identified material misstatements in the Strategic Report and the Directors' Report.</p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:StatementOnMattersOnWhichAuditorReportsByException" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">We have nothing to report in respect of the following matters where the Companies Act 2006 requires us to report to you if, in our opinion:</p><table style="width: 100%;"><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">adequate accounting records have not been kept, or returns adequate for our audit have not been received from branches not visited by us; or</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">the financial statements are not in agreement with the accounting records and returns; or</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">certain disclosures of directors' remuneration specified by law are not made; or</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width:3%;text-align:left;"><p class="Normal_Text">•</p></td><td><p class="Normal_Text">we have not received all the information and explanations we require for our audit.</p></td></tr></table></ix:nonNumeric>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:StatementResponsibilitiesManagementThoseChargedWithCorporateGovernance" xml:space="preserve"><p><span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;">Responsibilities of directors</span></p><p class="Normal_Text">As explained more fully in the Statement of Directors' Responsibilities [set out on page <a href="#PAGE7">7</a>], the directors are responsible for the preparation of the financial statements and for being satisfied that they give a true and fair view, and for such internal control as the directors determine is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.</p><p class="Normal_Text">In preparing the financial statements, the directors are responsible for assessing the company's ability to continue as a going concern, disclosing, as applicable, matters related to going concern and using the going concern basis of accounting unless the directors either intend to liquidate the company or to cease operations, or have no realistic alternative but to do so.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 9</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE10"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Auditor’s responsibilities for the audit of the financial statements</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor’s report that includes our opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with ISAs (UK) will always detect a material misstatement when it exists. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of these financial statements.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The extent to which our procedures are capable of detecting irregularities, including fraud is detailed below.<br/><br/>Irregularities, including fraud, are instances of non-compliance with laws and regulations. We design procedures in line with our responsibilities, outlined above, to detect material misstatements in respect of irregularities, including fraud.<br/><br/>In identifying and assessing the risks of material misstatements in respect of irregularities, including fraud and non compliance with laws and regulations we considered the nature of the company and the industry and the company's control environment. We identified specific laws and regulations which we considered may have a direct material effect on the financial statements or the operation of the company such as the Companies Act 2006, taxation legislation, employment laws and health and safety regulations.We assessed the extent of compliance with laws and regulations identified through making inquiries of management and discussing their policies and procedures regarding compliance with laws and regulations; inspecting correspondence, if any, with relevant licensing or regulatory authorities.<br/><br/>We evaluated the directors and management's incentives and opportunities for fraudulent manipulation of the financial statements, including the risk of management bias and override of controls. Our audit procedures to respond to the risks identified included but not limited to the following:<br/> </p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Performing analytical procedures to identify any unusual or unexpected relationships and testing appropriateness of journal entries and other adjustments.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Assessing whether judgements and assumptions made in determining accounting estimates were indicative of potential bias; and evaluating business rationale of any significant transactions that are unusual or outside the normal course of business.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Evaluating the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates and related disclosures made by the directors.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Evaluating the overall presentation, structure and content of the financial statements, including the disclosures, and whether the financial statements represent the underlying transactions and events in a manner that achieves fair presentation.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Obtaining sufficient appropriate audit evidence regarding the financial information of the entities or business activities within the company to express an opinion on the financial statements. We are responsible for the direction, supervision and performance of the company audit. We remain solely responsible for our audit opinion.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Identified laws and regulations and potential fraud risks were communicated to all engagement team member, and remained alert to any indications of fraud or non-compliance with laws and regulations throughout the audit.<br/><br/>There are inherent limitations in the audit procedures described above and the primary responsibility for the prevention and detection of irregularities including fraud rests with management. As with any audit, there remained a risk of non-detection of irregularities, as these may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omissions, misrepresentations or the override of internal controls.</p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 10</p>
            </td>

            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE11"> </a>
    </div>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION1">1</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Statutory information</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company is a private company limited by share capital, incorporated in Scotland.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The address of its registered office is:<br/><ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:AddressLine1">246 Flemington Street</ix:nonNumeric><br/><ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:AddressLine2">Springburn</ix:nonNumeric><br/><ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:PrincipalLocation-CityOrTown">Glasgow</ix:nonNumeric><br/><ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2021-01-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:PostalCodeZip">G21 4BY</ix:nonNumeric></p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements were authorised for issue by the <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionBodyAuthorisingFinancialStatements">Board</ix:nonNumeric> on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2021-01-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateSigningDirectorsReport">29 November 2023</ix:nonNumeric>.</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION2">2</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Accounting policies</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Statement of compliance</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:StatementComplianceWithApplicableReportingFramework" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements were prepared in accordance with Financial Reporting Standard 102 'The Financial Reporting Standard applicable in the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland and the Companies Act 2006'.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Basis of preparation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:GeneralDescriptionBasisMeasurementUsedInPreparingFinancialStatements" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements have been prepared using the historical cost convention except that as disclosed in the accounting policies certain items are shown at fair value.
<br/>
<br/>Exemption has been taken from preparing a cash flow statement on the grounds that the parent company includes the subsidiary in its published financial statements.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Going concern</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">After making enquiries, the Directors have a reasonable expectation that the company has adequate resources to continue in operational existence for at least twelve months from the date of this report. Accordingly, they continue to adopt the going concern basis in preparing the Company financial statements.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Revenue recognition</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:RevenueRecognitionPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Turnover comprises revenue recognised when goods are received by the customers and risks and rewards of ownership passed to them. Revenue represents amounts receivable for goods and services net of Value Added Tax and trade discounts.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Foreign currencies</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ForeignCurrencyTranslationOperationsPolicy">Assets and liabilities in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rates of exchange ruling at the balance sheet date. Transactions in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rate of exchange ruling at the date of transaction. Exchange differences are taken into account in arriving at the operating result.</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Tax</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">The tax expense for the period comprises current and deferred tax. Tax is recognised in profit or loss, except that a change attributable to an item of income or expense recognised as other comprehensive income is also recognised directly in other comprehensive income.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:CurrentIncomeTaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">The current income tax charge is calculated on the basis of tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date in the countries where the company operates and generates taxable income.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 15</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE16"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DeferredTaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Deferred tax is recognised in respect of all timing differences between taxable profits and profits reported in the financial statements.
<br/> 
<br/> Unrelieved tax losses and other deferred tax assets are recognised when it is probable that they will be recovered against the reversal of deferred tax liabilities or other future taxable profits.
<br/> 
<br/> Deferred tax is measured using the tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date and that are expected to apply to the reversal of the timing difference.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Tangible assets</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:PropertyPlantEquipmentPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Tangible fixed assets under the cost model, other than investment properties, are stated in the statement of financial position at historical cost, except use of GAAP value of land and buildings on 1 January 2014 as deemed cost, less any subsequent accumulated depreciation and subsequent accumulated impairment losses.
<br/> 
<br/>The cost of tangible assets includes directly attributable incremental costs incurred in their acquisition and installation.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Depreciation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionMeasurementBasisForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Depreciation is charged so as to write off the cost of assets, other than land and properties under construction over their estimated useful lives, as follows:
<br/>
<br/></p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr class="Description_Column_Heading_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-weight: bold;">Asset class</p>
          </td>
          <td style="width:37%;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-weight: bold;">Depreciation method and rate</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Freehold buildings</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-Buildings" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve"><p>50 years</p></ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Plant, fixtures and fittings</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-VehiclesPlantMachinery" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve"><p>5 to 7 years</p></ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Motor Vehicles</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-MotorVehicles" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve"><p>5 years</p></ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Freehold Land</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-Land" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve"><p>Freehold land is not depreciated.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Investment property</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:InvestmentPropertyPolicy">Investment property is carried at fair value, derived from the current market prices for comparable real estate determined annually by the directors. The fair value is determined by the directors based on the current estimated market rent value using observable market prices, adjusted if necessary for any difference in the nature, location or condition of the specific asset. Changes in fair value are recognised in profit or loss.</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Cash and cash equivalents</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:CashCashEquivalentsPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Cash and cash equivalents comprise cash on hand and call deposits, and other short-term highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to a known amount of cash and are subject to an insignificant risk of change in value.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Trade debtors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TradeReceivablesPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Trade debtors are amounts due from customers for merchandise sold or services performed in the ordinary course of business.
<br/> 
<br/> Trade debtors are recognised initially at the transaction price. They are subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method, less provision for impairment. A provision for the impairment of trade debtors is established when there is objective evidence that the company will not be able to collect all amounts due according to the original terms of the receivables.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Page 16</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:0px;">
      <a id="PAGE17"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Stocks</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:InventoriesPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Stocks are stated at the lower of cost and estimated selling price less costs to complete and sell. Cost is determined using the weighted average method. Costs of purchased stock are determined after deducting rebates and discounts. A provision is made for obsolete and slow moving items.
<br/> 
<br/> At each reporting date, stocks are assessed for impairment. If stocks are impaired, the carrying amount is reduced to its selling price less costs to complete and sell; the impairment loss is recognised immediately in profit or loss.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Trade creditors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TradePayablesPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Trade creditors are obligations to pay for goods or services that have been acquired in the ordinary course of business from suppliers. Accounts payable are classified as current liabilities if the company does not have an unconditional right, at the end of the reporting period, to defer settlement of the creditor for at least twelve months after the reporting date. If there is an unconditional right to defer settlement for at least twelve months after the reporting date, they are presented as non-current liabilities.
<br/> 
<br/> Trade creditors are recognised initially at the transaction price and subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Provisions</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ProvisionsPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Provisions are recognised when the company has an obligation at the reporting date as a result of a past event, it is probable that the company will be required to settle that obligation and a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Leases</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:LeasesPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Leases in which substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership are retained by the lessor are classified as operating leases. Payments made under operating leases are charged to profit or loss on a straight-line basis over the period of the lease.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Share capital</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ShareCapitalPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Ordinary shares are classified as equity. Equity instruments are measured at the fair value of the cash or other resources received or receivable, net of the direct costs of issuing the equity instruments. If payment is deferred and the time value of money is material, the initial measurement is on a present value basis.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Dividends</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DividendPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">Dividend distribution to the company’s shareholders is recognised as a liability in the financial statements in the reporting period in which the dividends are declared.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Defined contribution pension obligation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DefinedContributionPensionsPolicy" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Normal_Text">The company operates a defined contribution pension scheme. Contributions payable to the company's pension scheme are charged to profit or loss in the period to which they relate.</p></ix:nonNumeric>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Financial instruments</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <br/>
        <span class="Title_3_Text" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Classification</span>
        <br/>
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:FinancialInstrumentsClassificationPolicy">Financial instruments are classified and accounted for, according to the substance of the contractual arrangement, as either financial assets, financial liabilities or equity instruments. An equity instrument is any contract that evidences a residual interest in the assets of the company after deducting all of its liabilities.</ix:nonNumeric>
        <br/>
        <br/> <span class="Title_3_Text" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Recognition and measurement</span><br/><ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:FinancialInstrumentsRecognitionMeasurementPolicy" xml:space="preserve">Debt instruments (other than those wholly repayable or receivable within one year), including loans and other accounts receivable and payable, are initially measured at present value of the future cash flows and subsequently at amortised cost using the effective interest method. Debt instruments that are payable or receivable within one year, typically trade payables or receivables, are measured, initially and subsequently, at the undiscounted amount of the cash or other consideration, expected to be paid or received. However if the arrangement of a short-term instrument constitute a financing transaction, like the payment of a trade debt deferred beyond normal business terms or financed at a rate of interest that is not a market rate or in case of an out-right short-term loan not at a market rate, the financial asset or liability is measured, initially at the present value of the future cash flow discounted at a market rate of interest for a similar debt instrument and subsequently at a amortised cost. 
<br/>
<br/>Financial asset that are measured at cost and amortised cost are assessed at the end of each reporting period for objective evidence of impairment. If objective evidence of impairment is found, an impairment loss is recognised in the Statement of Income.</ix:nonNumeric><br/> <br/></p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">For financial assets measured at amortised cost, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between asset's carrying amount and the present value of estimated cash flows discounted at the asset's original effective interest rate. If a financial asset has a variable interest rate, the discount rate for measuring any impairment loss is current effective interest rate determined under the contract.<br/><br/>For financial assets measured at cost less impairment, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between an asset's carrying amount and best estimate, which is an approximation of the amount that the Company would receive for the asset if it were to be sold at the balance sheet date.<br/><br/>Financial assets and liabilities are offset and the net amount reported in the Balance Sheet when there is an enforceable right to set off the recognised amounts and there is an intention to settle on a net basis or to realise the asset and settle the liability simultaneously<br/> </p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">

            </td>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 16px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2022</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;font-weight: bold;color:#000000;">Significant judgements and estimates</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The preparation of accounts in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles requires the Directors to make judgements, estimates and assumptions that affect the application of policies and reported amounts of assets and liabilities, income and expenses. The estimates and associated assumptions are based on historical experience and other factors that are relevant. Actual results may differ from these estimates. The estimates and underlying assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis. Revisions to accounting estimates are recognised in the period in which the estimate is revised.<br/><br/>In preparing these financial statements, the directors have made the following judgements:<br/><br/>Tangible fixed assets, other than investment properties, are depreciated over their useful lives taking into account residual values, where appropriate. The actual lives of the assets and residual values are assessed annually and may vary depending on a number of factors. In re-assessing asset lives, factors such as technological innovation, product life cycles and maintenance programmes are taken into account. Residual value assessments consider issues such as future market conditions, the remaining life of the asset and projected disposal values.<br/><br/>Investment properties are valued each year. The directors consider market conditions and the value of similar property in deciding a fair value.<br/><br/>Bad debts are provided for where objective evidence of the need for a provision exists.<br/><br/>Stocks are assessed for evidence of obsolescence and a provision is made against any inventory unlikely to be sold.</p>

      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:GeneralDescriptionNatureProvisionIncludingTimingOutflowsMajorAssumptionsAboutFutureEvents" xml:space="preserve"><p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Deferred tax on revaluation surplus is £nil  due to  indexation allowance.
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>Excise duty
<br/>
<br/>In 2013 the company purchased certain goods from a supplier at a market price inclusive of excise duty. HM Revenue and Customs allege that the UK duty on the goods was not paid by the defaulting/missing trader or supplier, therefore any person involved in the holding of the excise goods is jointly and severally liable to pay the duty. Hence HM Revenue & Customs has raised an assessment for unpaid duty amounting to £713,992. The company lodged an appeal against the assessment awaiting hearing. Based on legal advice management believes that the defence against the assessment will be successful. Although liability is not admitted but because of uncertainty, a full provision has been made.</span></p></ix:nonNumeric>

            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Parent and ultimate parent undertaking</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company regarded United Holdings UK Ltd, incorporated in Scotland, as its ultimate parent company and the only group in which the results of the company are consolidated.<br/><br/>United Holdings UK Ltd is ultimately controlled by Mr and Mrs Ramzan and family.</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">

            </p>

            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Dividends</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Interim dividends paid during the year amounted to £567,738 (2021 - £872,300).</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION23">23</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Financial guarantee contracts</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company has given a bank guarantee in favour of HM Revenue and Customs in respect of excise duty deferment. The company is a party, together with the parent and sister companies, to a Guarantee Agreement with Clydesdale Bank PLC, whereby the liabilities to Clydesdale Bank PLC are cross guaranteed between the company,  its sister companies and the parent company.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The amount of the financial guarantee contract is £<ix:nonFraction xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.END" decimals="0" format="ixt:numcommadot" name="core:FinancialGuaranteeContracts" unitRef="GBP">2,500,000</ix:nonFraction>.</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION24">24</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Related party transactions</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company regarded United Holdings UK  Ltd as its ultimate parent company and the only group in which the results of the company are consolidated. The address of the registered office of the parent company is that of the company.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 13px;">Summary of transactions with entities with joint control or significant interest</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2021-01-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-RelatedPartiesDimension.core-EntitiesWithJointControlOrSignificantInfluenceOverReportingEntity" name="core:DescriptionNatureTransactionsBalancesWithRelatedParties" xml:space="preserve">Included in debtors is an amount of £250,026 (2021 - £250,000)  due  from Power Brands Intl Ltd, a company in which a director has material interest as shareholder.
<br/>
<br/>Debtors include a sum of £58,106 (2021 - £58,106) due from Sans Inc. Ltd, a company in which the shareholders of United Holdings UK Ltd, the parent company,  have material interest.
<br/>
<br/>Debtors include a sum of £151,446 due from RKH Barrhead Ltd, a company in which a director has material interest as shareholder.
<br/>
<br/>During the year, a total of key management personnel compensation of £597,154  (2021 - £309,663) was paid.</ix:nonNumeric>
        <br/> </p>
