The address of its registered office is: 246 Flemington Street Springburn Glasgow G21 4BY These financial statements were authorised for issue by the Board on 21 December 2021 . 2 Accounting policies Statement of compliance These financial statements were prepared in accordance with Financial Reporting Standard 102 'The Financial Reporting Standard applicable in the UK and Republic of Ireland'. Basis of preparation These financial statements have been prepared using the historical cost convention except that as disclosed in the accounting policies certain items are shown at fair value. Exemption has been taken from preparing a cash flow statement on the grounds that the parent company includes the subsidiary in its published financial statements. Going concern After making enquiries, the Directors have a reasonable expectation that the company has adequate resources to continue in operational existence for at least twelve months from the date of this report. Accordingly, they continue to adopt the going concern basis in preparing the Company financial statements. Revenue recognition Turnover comprises revenue recognised when goods are received by the customers and risks and rewards of ownership passed to them. Revenue represents amounts receivable for goods and services net of Value Added Tax and trade discounts. Foreign currencies Assets and liabilities in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rates of exchange ruling at the balance sheet date. Transactions in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rate of exchange ruling at the date of transaction. Exchange differences are taken into account in arriving at the operating result. Tax The tax expense for the period comprises current and deferred tax. Tax is recognised in profit or loss, except that a change attributable to an item of income or expense recognised as other comprehensive income is also recognised directly in other comprehensive income. The current income tax charge is calculated on the basis of tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date in the countries where the company operates and generates taxable income. Page 13 United Wholesale Grocers Limited Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2020 Deferred tax is recognised in respect of all timing differences between taxable profits and profits reported in the financial statements. Unrelieved tax losses and other deferred tax assets are recognised when it is probable that they will be recovered against the reversal of deferred tax liabilities or other future taxable profits. Deferred tax is measured using the tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date and that are expected to apply to the reversal of the timing difference. Tangible assets Tangible fixed assets under the cost model, other than investment properties, are stated in the statement of financial position at historical cost, except use of GAAP value of land and buildings on 1 January 2014 as deemed cost, less any subsequent accumulated depreciation and subsequent accumulated impairment losses. The cost of tangible assets includes directly attributable incremental costs incurred in their acquisition and installation. Depreciation Depreciation is charged so as to write off the cost of assets, other than land and properties under construction over their estimated useful lives, as follows: Asset class Depreciation method and rate Freehold buildings 50 years Plant, fixtures and fittings 5 to 7 years Motor Vehicles 5 years Freehold Land Freehold land is not depreciated. Investment property Investment property is carried at fair value, derived from the current market prices for comparable real estate determined annually by the directors. The fair value is determined by the directors based on the current estimated market rent value using observable market prices, adjusted if necessary for any difference in the nature, location or condition of the specific asset. Changes in fair value are recognised in profit or loss. Cash and cash equivalents Cash and cash equivalents comprise cash on hand and call deposits, and other short-term highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to a known amount of cash and are subject to an insignificant risk of change in value. Trade debtors Trade debtors are amounts due from customers for merchandise sold or services performed in the ordinary course of business. Trade debtors are recognised initially at the transaction price. They are subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method, less provision for impairment. A provision for the impairment of trade debtors is established when there is objective evidence that the company will not be able to collect all amounts due according to the original terms of the receivables. Page 14 United Wholesale Grocers Limited Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2020 Stocks Stocks are stated at the lower of cost and estimated selling price less costs to complete and sell. Cost is determined using the weighted average method. At each reporting date, stocks are assessed for impairment. If stocks are impaired, the carrying amount is reduced to its selling price less costs to complete and sell; the impairment loss is recognised immediately in profit or loss. Trade creditors Trade creditors are obligations to pay for goods or services that have been acquired in the ordinary course of business from suppliers. Accounts payable are classified as current liabilities if the company does not have an unconditional right, at the end of the reporting period, to defer settlement of the creditor for at least twelve months after the reporting date. If there is an unconditional right to defer settlement for at least twelve months after the reporting date, they are presented as non-current liabilities. Trade creditors are recognised initially at the transaction price and subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method. Provisions Provisions are recognised when the company has an obligation at the reporting date as a result of a past event, it is probable that the company will be required to settle that obligation and a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation. Leases Leases in which substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership are retained by the lessor are classified as operating leases. Payments made under operating leases are charged to profit or loss on a straight-line basis over the period of the lease. Leases are classified as finance leases whenever the terms of the lease transfer substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership to the lessee. Assets held under finance leases are recognised at the lower of their fair value at inception of the lease and the present value of the minimum lease payments. These assets are depreciated on a straight-line basis over the shorter of the useful life of the asset and the lease term. The corresponding liability to the lessor is included in the Balance Sheet as a finance lease obligation. Lease payments are apportioned between finance costs in the Statement of Comprehensive Income and reduction of the lease obligation so as to achieve a constant periodic rate of interest on the remaining balance of the liability. Share capital Ordinary shares are classified as equity. Equity instruments are measured at the fair value of the cash or other resources received or receivable, net of the direct costs of issuing the equity instruments. If payment is deferred and the time value of money is material, the initial measurement is on a present value basis. Dividends Dividend distribution to the company’s shareholders is recognised as a liability in the financial statements in the reporting period in which the dividends are declared. Defined contribution pension obligation The company operates a defined contribution pension scheme. Contributions payable to the company's pension scheme are charged to profit or loss in the period to which they relate. Page 15 United Wholesale Grocers Limited Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2020 Financial instruments Classification Financial instruments are classified and accounted for, according to the substance of the contractual arrangement, as either financial assets, financial liabilities or equity instruments. An equity instrument is any contract that evidences a residual interest in the assets of the company after deducting all of its liabilities. Recognition and measurement Debt instruments (other than those wholly repayable or receivable within one year), including loans and other accounts receivable and payable, are initially measured at present value of the future cash flows and subsequently at amortised cost using the effective interest method. Debt instruments that are payable or receivable within one year, typically trade payables or receivables, are measured, initially and subsequently, at the undiscounted amount of the cash or other consideration, expected to be paid or received. However if the arrangement of a short-term instrument constitute a financing transaction, like the payment of a trade debt deferred beyond normal business terms or financed at a rate of interest that is not a market rate or in case of an out-right short-term loan not at a market rate, the financial asset or liability is measured, initially at the present value of the future cash flow discounted at a market rate of interest for a similar debt instrument and subsequently at a amortised cost. Financial asset that are measured at cost and amortised cost are assessed at the end of each reporting period for objective evidence of impairment. If objective evidence of impairment is found, an impairment loss is recognised in the Statement of Income. For financial assets measured at amortised cost, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between asset's carrying amount and the present value of estimated cash flows discounted at the asset's original effective interest rate. If a financial asset has a variable interest rate, the discount rate for measuring any impairment loss is current effective interest rate determined under the contract. For financial assets measured at cost less impairment, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between an asset's carrying amount and best estimate, which is an approximation of the amount that the Company would receive for the asset if it were to be sold at the balance sheet date. Financial assets and liabilities are offset and the net amount reported in the Balance Sheet when there is an enforceable right to set off the recognised amounts and there is an intention to settle on a net basis or to realise the asset and settle the liability simultaneously Page 16 United Wholesale Grocers Limited Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2020 Significant judgements and estimates The preparation of accounts in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles requires the Directors to make judgements, estimates and assumptions that affect the application of policies and reported amounts of assets and liabilities, income and expenses. The estimates and associated assumptions are based on historical experience and other factors that are relevant. Actual results may differ from these estimates. The estimates and underlying assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis. Revisions to accounting estimates are recognised in the period in which the estimate is revised. The actual lives of the assets and residual values are assessed annually and may vary depending on a number of factors. In re-assessing asset lives, factors such as technological innovation, product life cycles and maintenance programmes are taken into account. Residual value assessments consider issues such as future market conditions, the remaining life of the asset and projected disposal values. Investment properties are valued each year.     <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Strategic Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">The directors present their strategic report for the year ended 31 December 2019. </span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Review of Business</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">2019 has been a year of consolidation for the company. Gateshead depot acquired in July 2018 has performed well  as expected. Despite difficult business conditions, we have have maintained our market share.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>During the year the company's turnover increased  by 12.97% to £167.57 million from £148.3 million in 2018. Turnover included a  full year trading of Gateshead depot compared to 6 months in 2018. Like for like turnover increased by 2.08%. Gross profit increased by 31.21% to £10.5  million from £8  million in 2018. Gross margin  improved, up from 5.39% to 6.26%, this was due  to better bulk buying discounts. Profit before tax increased to £3.1 million from £2 million in the previous year. This was driven by maintaining  tight control over operating costs and buying.discounts.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The operating profit was up by 72.4% from £1.74 million  in 2018 to £3.0 million in 2019.  The company's balance sheet strengthened further by retaining net profit after dividends. </p>
      <p>
        <span class="Normal_Text">The company's key financial and other performance indicators during the year were as follows:</span>
      </p>

      <p/>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Principal risks and uncertainties</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The most significant risks to the achievement of the company's business goal are as follows:
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The industry is extremely competitive with the market being served by numerous competitors, ranging from national multiple retailers to regional independent wholesalers. We are continuing to keep our core prices at market leading levels to provide the best possible margin for our customers.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Among the financial performance indicator, the key performance indicators are gross profit margin, sales per department, wages per depot, stock availability and stock levels.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Availability of suppliers credit is essential for the company's financial performance. Any reduction in the availability of supplier credit could adversely impact the company.The company closely manage credit terms to ensure that they are met.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The company maintains tight credit control to minimise its exposure to doubtful debts.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>General non-financial performance indicators are staff turnover, staff, suppliers and customers satisfaction, and health and safety  reprts, amongst others. The Board is of the belief that the monitoring of the aforementioned indicators is an effective aspect of business performace review.</p>

      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Strategic Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Environmental Report</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company has where possible continued to implement technologies to reduce its carbon imprint. The packaging material was processed off through waste management companies. The company complied with waste management disposal regulations.</p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">

      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Directors' Report for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">The directors present their report and the financial statements for the year ended 31 December 2019. </span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Dividends</span>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Particulars of dividends are detailed in the notes to the financial statements.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Events since the end of the year</span>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Information relating to events since the end of the year is given in the notes to the financial statements.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Directors of the company</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The directors who held office during the year were as follows:</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director1" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">M Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director2" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">N Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director3" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">W Badar</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityOfficersDimension.bus-Director4" name="bus:NameEntityOfficer">A Ramzan</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Financial Instruments</span>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Details of the company's financial risk management objectives and policies are included in notes to the accounts.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Political donations and expenditure</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Charitable contributions made by the company during the year amounted to £20,274 (2018 - £7,955).</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Employee involvement</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:DescriptionArrangementsRelatedToEmployeesSuchAsProvisionInformationConsultation" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">It is the company policy to involve employees in the business and to ensure that matters of concern to them, including company's aims and objectives and its financial performance, are communicated in an open and regular way and, when appropriate,employees' view are taken into account. 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The promotion of equal opportunities for all employees, including disabled persons,is regarded as an important priority. Applications for employment and promotion of disabled persons are treated on the basis as those from other applicants having regard to aptitude, ability, requirements of the job.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Disclosure of information to the auditors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:StatementOnQualityCompletenessInformationProvidedToAuditors" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Each director has taken steps that they ought to have taken as a director in order to make themselves aware of any relevant audit information and to establish that the company's auditors are aware of that information. The directors confirm that there is no relevant information that they know of and of which they know the auditors are unaware.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Approved by the <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionBodyAuthorisingFinancialStatements">Board</ix:nonNumeric> on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateSigningDirectorsReport">29 December 2020</ix:nonNumeric> on its behalf by:</span>
      </p>

          <br/>

      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Statement of Directors' Responsibilities</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/direp" contextRef="FY1" name="direp:StatementThatDirectorsAcknowledgeTheirResponsibilitiesUnderCompaniesAct" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">The directors acknowledge their responsibilities for preparing the Annual Report and the financial statements in accordance with applicable law and regulations.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Company law requires the directors to prepare financial statements for each financial year. Under that law the directors have elected to prepare the financial statements in accordance with United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice (United Kingdom Accounting Standards and applicable law). Under company law the directors must not approve the financial statements unless they are satisfied that they give a true and fair view of the state of affairs of the company and of the profit or loss of the company for that period. In preparing these financial statements, the directors are required to:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">select suitable accounting policies and apply them consistently;</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">make judgements and accounting estimates that are reasonable and prudent;</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">state whether applicable UK Accounting Standards have been followed, subject to any material departures disclosed and explained in the financial statements; and</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">prepare the financial statements on the going concern basis unless it is inappropriate to presume that the company will continue in business.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p>
        <span class="Normal_Text">The directors are responsible for keeping adequate accounting records that are sufficient to show and explain the company's transactions and disclose with reasonable accuracy at any time the financial position of the company and enable them to ensure that the financial statements comply with the Companies Act 2006. They are also responsible for safeguarding the assets of the company and hence for taking reasonable steps for the prevention and detection of fraud and other irregularities.</span>
      </p>

    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:1px;">
      <a id="PAGE6"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Opinion</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We have audited  the financial statements of United Wholesale Grocers Limited (the 'company') for the year ended 31 December 2019, which comprise the Statement of Comprehensive Income, Statement of Comprehensive Income, Balance Sheet, Statement of Changes in Equity, and Notes to the Financial Statements, including a summary of significant accounting policies. The financial reporting framework that has been applied in their preparation is applicable law and United Kingdom Accounting Standards, including Financial Reporting Standard 102 The Financial Reporting Standard applicable in the UK and Republic of Ireland (United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice).</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">This report is made solely to the company’s members, as a body, in accordance with Chapter 3 of Part 16 of the Companies Act 2006. Our audit work has been undertaken so that we might state to the company’s members those matters we are required to state to them in an auditor’s report and for no other purpose. To the fullest extent permitted by law, we do not accept or assume responsibility to anyone other than the company and the company’s members as a body, for our audit work, for this report, or for the opinions we have formed.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In our opinion the financial statements:</p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:OpinionAuditorsOnEntity" xml:space="preserve">
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">give a true and fair view of the state of the company's affairs as at 31 December 2019 and of its profit  for the year then ended;</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">have been properly prepared in accordance with United Kingdom Generally Accepted Accounting Practice; and</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">have been prepared in accordance with the requirements of the Companies Act 2006.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Basis for opinion</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (UK) (ISAs (UK)) and applicable law. Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the Auditor’s responsibilities for the audit of the financial statements section of our report. We are independent of the company in accordance with the ethical requirements that are relevant to our audit of the financial statements in the UK, including the FRC’s Ethical Standard, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Conclusions relating to going concern</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We have nothing to report in respect of the following matters in relation to which the ISAs (UK) require us to report to you where:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the directors’ use of the going concern basis of accounting in the preparation of the financial statements is not appropriate; or</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the directors have not disclosed in the financial statements any identified material uncertainties that may cast significant doubt about the company’s ability to continue to adopt the going concern basis of accounting for a period of at least twelve months from the date when the financial statements are authorised for issue.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Other information</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The directors are responsible for the other information. The other information comprises the information included in the annual report, other than the financial statements and our auditor’s report thereon. Our opinion on the financial statements does not cover the other information and, except to the extent otherwise explicitly stated in our report, we do not express any form of assurance conclusion thereon.</p>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In connection with our audit of the financial statements, our responsibility is to read the other information and, in doing so, consider whether the other information is materially inconsistent with the financial statements or our knowledge obtained in the audit or otherwise appears to be materially misstated. If we identify such material inconsistencies or apparent material misstatements, we are required to determine whether there is a material misstatement in the financial statements or a material misstatement of the other information. If, based on the work we have performed, we conclude that there is a material misstatement of this other information, we are required to report that fact.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We have nothing to report in this regard.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Opinion on other matter prescribed by the Companies Act 2006</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In our opinion, based on the work undertaken in the course of the audit:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the information given in the Strategic Report and Directors' Report for the financial year for which the financial statements are prepared is consistent with the financial statements; and</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">the Strategic Report and Directors' Report have been prepared in accordance with applicable legal requirements.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Matters on which we are required to report by exception</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In the light of our knowledge and understanding of the company and its environment obtained in the course of the audit, we have not identified material misstatements in the Strategic Report and the Directors' Report.</p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:aurep="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/aurep" contextRef="FY1" name="aurep:StatementOnMattersOnWhichAuditorReportsByException" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">We have nothing to report in respect of the following matters where the Companies Act 2006 requires us to report to you if, in our opinion:</p>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">adequate accounting records have not been kept, or returns adequate for our audit have not been received from branches not visited by us; or</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">the financial statements are not in agreement with the accounting records and returns; or</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">certain disclosures of directors’ remuneration specified by law are not made; or</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
<p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
</td>
<td>
<p class="Normal_Text">we have not received all the information and explanations we require for our audit.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p>
        <span class="Normal_Text" style="font-weight: bold;">Responsibilities of directors</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">As explained more fully in the Statement of Directors' Responsibilities [set out on page <a href="#PAGE5" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">5</a>], the directors are responsible for the preparation of the financial statements and for being satisfied that they give a true and fair view, and for such internal control as the directors determine is necessary to enable the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">In preparing the financial statements, the directors are responsible for assessing the company's ability to continue as a going concern, disclosing, as applicable, matters related to going concern and using the going concern basis of accounting unless the directors either intend to liquidate the company or to cease operations, or have no realistic alternative but to do so.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Auditor’s responsibilities for the audit of the financial statements</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor’s report that includes our opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with ISAs (UK) will always detect a material misstatement when it exists. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of these financial statements.</p>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">

    </div>

    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Independent Auditor's Report to the Members of United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">As part of an audit in accordance with ISAs (UK), we exercise professional judgement and maintain professional scepticism throughout the audit. We also:</p>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement of the financial statements, whether due to fraud or error, design and perform audit procedures responsive to those risks, and obtain audit evidence that is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion. The risk of not detecting a material misstatement resulting from fraud is higher than for one resulting from error, as fraud may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omissions, misrepresentations, or the override of internal control.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Obtain an understanding of internal control relevant to the audit in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the company’s internal control.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Evaluate the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates and related disclosures made by the directors.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Conclude on the appropriateness of the directors' use of the going concern basis of accounting and, based on the audit evidence obtained, whether a material uncertainty exists related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt on the company's ability to continue as a going concern. If we conclude that a material uncertainty exists, we are required to draw attention in our auditor’s report to the related disclosures in the financial statements or, if such disclosures are inadequate, to modify our opinion. Our conclusions are based on the audit evidence obtained up to the date of our auditor’s report. However, future events or conditions may cause the company to cease to continue as a going concern.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Evaluate the overall presentation, structure and content of the financial statements, including the disclosures, and whether the financial statements represent the underlying transactions and events in a manner that achieves fair presentation.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table style="width: 100%;">
        <tr>
          <td style="width:3%;text-align:left;">
            <p class="Normal_Text">•</p>
          </td>
          <td>
            <p class="Normal_Text">Obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence regarding the financial information of the entities or business activities within the company to express an opinion on the financial statements. We are responsible for the direction, supervision and performance of the company audit. We remain solely responsible for our audit opinion.</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">We communicate with those charged with governance regarding, among other matters, the planned scope and timing of the audit and significant audit findings, including any significant deficiencies in internal control that we identify during our audit.</p>

            </p>

    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION1">1</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Statutory information</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company is a private company limited by share capital, incorporated in Scotland.</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The address of its registered office is:<br/>
<ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:AddressLine1">246 Flemington Street</ix:nonNumeric>
<br/>
<ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:AddressLine2">Springburn</ix:nonNumeric>
<br/>
<ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:PrincipalLocation-CityOrTown">Glasgow</ix:nonNumeric>
<br/>
<ix:nonNumeric xmlns:bus="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/cd/2014-09-01/business" contextRef="FY1.segment.bus-EntityContactTypeDimension.bus-RegisteredOffice" name="bus:PostalCodeZip">G21 4BY</ix:nonNumeric>
</p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements were authorised for issue by the <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionBodyAuthorisingFinancialStatements">Board</ix:nonNumeric> on <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:direp="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/reports/2014-09-01/direp" contextRef="FY1.END" format="ixt:datelonguk" name="direp:DateSigningDirectorsReport">29 December 2020</ix:nonNumeric>.</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION2">2</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Accounting policies</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Statement of compliance</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:StatementComplianceWithApplicableReportingFramework" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements were prepared in accordance with Financial Reporting Standard 102 'The Financial Reporting Standard applicable in the UK and Republic of Ireland'.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Basis of preparation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:GeneralDescriptionBasisMeasurementUsedInPreparingFinancialStatements" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">These financial statements have been prepared using the historical cost convention except that as disclosed in the accounting policies certain items are shown at fair value.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Exemption has been taken from preparing a cash flow statement on the grounds that the parent company includes the subsidiary in its published financial statements.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Going concern</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">After making enquiries, the Directors have a reasonable expectation that the company has adequate resources to continue in operational existence for at least twelve months from the date of this report. Accordingly, they continue to adopt the going concern basis in preparing the Company financial statements.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Revenue recognition</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:RevenueRecognitionPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Turnover comprises revenue recognised when goods are received by the customers and risks and rewards of ownership passed to them. Revenue represents amounts receivable for goods and services net of Value Added Tax and trade discounts.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Foreign currencies</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ForeignCurrencyTranslationOperationsPolicy">Assets and liabilities in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rates of exchange ruling at the balance sheet date. Transactions in foreign currencies are translated into sterling at the rate of exchange ruling at the date of transaction. Exchange differences are taken into account in arriving at the operating result.</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Tax</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">The tax expense for the period comprises current and deferred tax. Tax is recognised in profit or loss, except that a change attributable to an item of income or expense recognised as other comprehensive income is also recognised directly in other comprehensive income.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:CurrentIncomeTaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">The current income tax charge is calculated on the basis of tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date in the countries where the company operates and generates taxable income.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Page 12</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:1px;">
      <a id="PAGE13"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DeferredTaxPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Deferred tax is recognised in respect of all timing differences between taxable profits and profits reported in the financial statements.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Unrelieved tax losses and other deferred tax assets are recognised when it is probable that they will be recovered against the reversal of deferred tax liabilities or other future taxable profits.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Deferred tax is measured using the tax rates and laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date and that are expected to apply to the reversal of the timing difference.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Tangible assets</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:PropertyPlantEquipmentPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Tangible fixed assets under the cost model, other than investment properties, are stated in the statement of financial position at historical cost, except use of GAAP value of land and buildings on 1 January 2014 as deemed cost, less any subsequent accumulated depreciation and subsequent accumulated impairment losses.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The cost of tangible assets includes directly attributable incremental costs incurred in their acquisition and installation.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Depreciation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DescriptionMeasurementBasisForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Depreciation is charged so as to write off the cost of assets, other than land and properties under construction over their estimated useful lives, as follows:
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr class="Description_Column_Heading_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-weight: bold;">Asset class</p>
          </td>
          <td style="width:37%;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-weight: bold;">Depreciation method and rate</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Freehold buildings</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-Buildings" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve">
<p>50 years</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Plant, fixtures and fittings</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-VehiclesPlantMachinery" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve">
<p>5 to 7 years</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Motor Vehicles</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-MotorVehicles" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve">
<p>5 years</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
        <tr class="Section_Breakdown_Rows_Text">
          <td style="width:62%;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p>Freehold Land</p>
          </td>
          <td style="min-width:226px;padding-top:0px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-PropertyPlantEquipmentClassesDimension.core-Land" name="core:DescriptionDepreciationMethodForPropertyPlantEquipment" xml:space="preserve">
<p>Freehold land is not depreciated.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Investment property</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:InvestmentPropertyPolicy">Investment property is carried at fair value, derived from the current market prices for comparable real estate determined annually by the directors. The fair value is determined by the directors based on the current estimated market rent value using observable market prices, adjusted if necessary for any difference in the nature, location or condition of the specific asset. Changes in fair value are recognised in profit or loss.</ix:nonNumeric>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Cash and cash equivalents</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:CashCashEquivalentsPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Cash and cash equivalents comprise cash on hand and call deposits, and other short-term highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to a known amount of cash and are subject to an insignificant risk of change in value.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Trade debtors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TradeReceivablesPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Trade debtors are amounts due from customers for merchandise sold or services performed in the ordinary course of business.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Trade debtors are recognised initially at the transaction price. They are subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method, less provision for impairment. A provision for the impairment of trade debtors is established when there is objective evidence that the company will not be able to collect all amounts due according to the original terms of the receivables.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Page 13</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:1px;">
      <a id="PAGE14"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Stocks</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:InventoriesPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Stocks are stated at the lower of cost and estimated selling price less costs to complete and sell. Cost is determined using the weighted average method.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> At each reporting date, stocks are assessed for impairment. If stocks are impaired, the carrying amount is reduced to its selling price less costs to complete and sell; the impairment loss is recognised immediately in profit or loss.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Trade creditors</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:TradePayablesPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Trade creditors are obligations to pay for goods or services that have been acquired in the ordinary course of business from suppliers. Accounts payable are classified as current liabilities if the company does not have an unconditional right, at the end of the reporting period, to defer settlement of the creditor for at least twelve months after the reporting date. If there is an unconditional right to defer settlement for at least twelve months after the reporting date, they are presented as non-current liabilities.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Trade creditors are recognised initially at the transaction price and subsequently measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Provisions</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ProvisionsPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Provisions are recognised when the company has an obligation at the reporting date as a result of a past event, it is probable that the company will be required to settle that obligation and a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Leases</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:LeasesPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Leases in which substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership are retained by the lessor are classified as operating leases. Payments made under operating leases are charged to profit or loss on a straight-line basis over the period of the lease. Leases are classified as finance leases whenever the terms of the lease transfer substantially all the risks and rewards of ownership to the lessee.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Assets held under finance leases are recognised at the lower of their fair value at inception of the lease and the present value of the minimum lease payments. These assets are depreciated on a straight-line basis over the shorter of the useful life of the asset and the lease term. The corresponding liability to the lessor is included in the Balance Sheet as a finance lease obligation.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> Lease payments are apportioned between finance costs in the Statement of Comprehensive Income and reduction of the lease obligation so as to achieve a constant periodic rate of interest on the remaining balance of the liability.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Share capital</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:ShareCapitalPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Ordinary shares are classified as equity. Equity instruments are measured at the fair value of the cash or other resources received or receivable, net of the direct costs of issuing the equity instruments. If payment is deferred and the time value of money is material, the initial measurement is on a present value basis.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Dividends</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DividendPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">Dividend distribution to the company’s shareholders is recognised as a liability in the financial statements in the reporting period in which the dividends are declared.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Defined contribution pension obligation</span>
      </p>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:DefinedContributionPensionsPolicy" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">The company operates a defined contribution pension scheme. Contributions payable to the company's pension scheme are charged to profit or loss in the period to which they relate.</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <div class="footer">
        <table style="width:100%;">
          <tr>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:39%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Page 14</p>
            </td>
            <td class="Page_Footer_Text" style="width:30%;">
              <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;"/>
            </td>
          </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="page-break-before:always;height:1px;">
      <a id="PAGE15"> </a>
    </div>
    <div class="portraitpage">
      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Financial instruments</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
        <span class="Title_3_Text" style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Classification</span>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:FinancialInstrumentsClassificationPolicy">Financial instruments are classified and accounted for, according to the substance of the contractual arrangement, as either financial assets, financial liabilities or equity instruments. An equity instrument is any contract that evidences a residual interest in the assets of the company after deducting all of its liabilities.</ix:nonNumeric>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> <span class="Title_3_Text" style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">Recognition and measurement</span>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:FinancialInstrumentsRecognitionMeasurementPolicy" xml:space="preserve">Debt instruments (other than those wholly repayable or receivable within one year), including loans and other accounts receivable and payable, are initially measured at present value of the future cash flows and subsequently at amortised cost using the effective interest method. Debt instruments that are payable or receivable within one year, typically trade payables or receivables, are measured, initially and subsequently, at the undiscounted amount of the cash or other consideration, expected to be paid or received. However if the arrangement of a short-term instrument constitute a financing transaction, like the payment of a trade debt deferred beyond normal business terms or financed at a rate of interest that is not a market rate or in case of an out-right short-term loan not at a market rate, the financial asset or liability is measured, initially at the present value of the future cash flow discounted at a market rate of interest for a similar debt instrument and subsequently at a amortised cost. 
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Financial asset that are measured at cost and amortised cost are assessed at the end of each reporting period for objective evidence of impairment. If objective evidence of impairment is found, an impairment loss is recognised in the Statement of Income.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>For financial assets measured at amortised cost, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between asset's carrying amount and the present value of estimated cash flows discounted at the asset's original effective interest rate. If a financial asset has a variable interest rate, the discount rate for measuring any impairment loss is current effective interest rate determined under the contract.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>For financial assets measured at cost less impairment, the impairment loss is measured as the difference between an asset's carrying amount and best estimate, which is an approximation of the amount that the Company would receive for the asset if it were to be sold at the balance sheet date.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Financial assets and liabilities are offset and the net amount reported in the Balance Sheet when there is an enforceable right to set off the recognised amounts and there is an intention to settle on a net basis or to realise the asset and settle the liability simultaneously
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
</ix:nonNumeric>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> </p>

      <p class="Primary_Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 14px;font-weight: bold;">United Wholesale Grocers Limited</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Page_Header_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;">Notes to the Financial Statements for the Year Ended 31 December 2019</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Title_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;font-weight: bold;color:#000000;">Significant judgements and estimates</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The preparation of accounts in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles requires the Directors to make judgements, estimates and assumptions that affect the application of policies and reported amounts of assets and liabilities, income and expenses. The estimates and associated assumptions are based on historical experience and other factors that are relevant. Actual results may differ from these estimates. The estimates and underlying assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis. Revisions to accounting estimates are recognised in the period in which the estimate is revised.<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>In preparing these financial statements, the directors have made the following judgements:<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Tangible fixed assets, other than investment properties, are depreciated over their useful lives taking into account residual values, where appropriate. The actual lives of the assets and residual values are assessed annually and may vary depending on a number of factors. In re-assessing asset lives, factors such as technological innovation, product life cycles and maintenance programmes are taken into account. Residual value assessments consider issues such as future market conditions, the remaining life of the asset and projected disposal values.<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Investment properties are valued each year. The directors consider market conditions and the value of similar property in deciding a fair value.<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Bad debts are provided for where objective evidence of the need for a provision exists.<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Stocks are assessed for evidence of obsolescence and a provision is made against any inventory unlikely to be sold.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Cost of Sales</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Cost of sales represents all costs incurred, net of supplier rebates (see below), up to the point of sale including the operating expenses of the trading outlets.</p>

        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">The tax on profit before tax for the year is the same as the standard rate of corporation tax in the UK (2018 - the same as the standard rate of corporation tax in the UK) of <span class="Percentage_Text" style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<ix:nonFraction xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-TaxJurisdictionDimension.core-UKTax" decimals="2" name="core:ApplicableTaxRate" scale="-2" unitRef="Pure">19</ix:nonFraction>%</span> (2018 - <span class="Percentage_Text" style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<ix:nonFraction xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY2.segment.core-TaxJurisdictionDimension.core-UKTax" decimals="2" name="core:ApplicableTaxRate" scale="-2" unitRef="Pure">19</ix:nonFraction>%</span>).<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>The differences are reconciled below:</span>
      </p>
      <table style="width:100%;">

            <p class="Comparative_Smart_Table_Right_Text" style="margin-bottom:0px;margin-right:3px;font-weight: bold;">2018<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>£</p>
          </td>

      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1" name="core:GeneralDescriptionNatureProvisionIncludingTimingOutflowsMajorAssumptionsAboutFutureEvents" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Spaced_Paragraph_Text" style="margin-top:18px;">
<span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Deferred tax on revaluation surplus is £nil  after deduction of indexation allowance.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>Excise duty
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>In 2013 the company purchased certain goods from a supplier at a market price inclusive of excise duty. HM Revenue and Customs allege that the UK duty on the goods was not paid by the defaulting/missing trader or supplier, therefore any person involved in the holding of the excise goods is jointly and severally liable to pay the duty. Hence HM Revenue & Customs has raised an assessment for unpaid duty amounting to £713,992. The company lodged an appeal against the assessment awaiting hearing. Based on legal advice management believes that the defence against the assessment will be successful. Although liability is not admitted but because of uncertainty, a full provision has been made.</span>
</p>
</ix:nonNumeric>

            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Dividends</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">Interim dividends paid during the year amounted to £630,953 (2018 - £569,882).</p>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">

            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Contingent liabilities</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-ContingentLiabilitiesClassesDimension.core-FinancialGuarantees" name="core:GeneralDescriptionContingentLiabilitiesIncludingFinancialEffectUncertaintiesPossibleReimbursement" xml:space="preserve">
<p class="Normal_Text">The company has a contingent bank guarantee up to £2,000,000 in favour of HM Revenue and Customs in respect of duty deferment.  The company is a party, together with the other companies within the United Holdings UK Ltd Group, to a Guarantee Agreement with Clydesdale Bank plc, whereby the liabilities to Clydesdale Bank of each subsidiary are cross guaranteed by each of the companies.   </p>
</ix:nonNumeric>
      <table style="width:100%;">
        <tr>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:3%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">
              <a id="SECTION25">25</a>
            </p>
          </td>
          <td class="Note_Heading_Text" style="width:96%;padding-top:24px;padding-bottom:0px;">
            <p style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Related party transactions</p>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <p class="Normal_Text">The company regarded United Holdings UK  Ltd as its ultimate parent company and the only group in which the results of the company are consolidated. The address of the registered office of the parent company is that of the company.</p>
      <p class="Title_1_Text">
        <span style="font-family:Arial;font-size: 13px;">Summary of transactions with entities with joint control or significant interest</span>
      </p>
      <p class="Normal_Text">
        <ix:nonNumeric xmlns:core="http://xbrl.frc.org.uk/fr/2014-09-01/core" contextRef="FY1.segment.core-RelatedPartiesDimension.core-EntitiesWithJointControlOrSignificantInfluenceOverReportingEntity" name="core:DescriptionNatureTransactionsBalancesWithRelatedParties" xml:space="preserve">United Properties (Scotland) Limited is a company in which close family members of a director of United Wholesale Grocers Limited are director and shareholder. Included in the debtors is the balance of £102  (2018 - £102) due from United Properties (Scotland) Limited.
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>During the year, a total of key management personnel compensation of £283,163 (2018 - £252,001) was paid.</ix:nonNumeric>
        <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/> </p>

      <p class="Normal_Text">The company regarded United Holdings UK Ltd, incorporated in Scotland, as its ultimate parent company and the only group in which the results of the company are consolidated.<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>
<br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"/>United Holdings UK Ltd is ultimately controlled by Mr and Mrs Ramzan and family.</p>
